title: Should Runners Lift Heavy? Science Says Yes | StrongerStride
description: Research shows heavy resistance training improves running economy by 2-8% while high-rep training shows zero performance benefit. Learn why runners should lift heavy weights (80-90% 1-RM, 3-6 reps) and stop wasting time on bodyweight circuits.
author: Dr. Spencer Agnew, DPT
keywords: should runners lift heavy weights, heavy weights vs high reps for runners, will lifting heavy make me bulky, strength training myths for runners, best rep range for runners

title: Stride Length vs. Stride Frequency for Distance Runners | StrongerStride
description: Research reveals distance runners rely on ankle strength for stride length, not hip muscles like sprinters. Learn which muscles power YOUR race pace, why the 7 m/s threshold matters, and how to train the right muscles for maximum performance.
author: Dr. Spencer Agnew, DPT
keywords: stride length, stride frequency, cadence, running speed, calf strength, soleus muscle, ankle plantarflexors, distance running, running biomechanics, running performance

title: Why Calf Strength Matters for Distance Runners | Stronger Stride
description: Research shows calf muscles are the primary drivers of distance running performance up to 4:17/mile pace. Learn why your calves matter more than your quads, what tests reveal about your weakness, and the 5 exercises that build race-winning calf strength.
author: Dr. Spencer Agnew, DPT
keywords: running, injury prevention, strength training, biomechanics, calf strength, running performance, soleus, gastrocnemius, Achilles tendon

title: IT Band Syndrome: Why Hip Strength is the Real Solution | StrongerStride
